data.title: Find can't find \n when it's preceded by anything
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Win 10 1607

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open any file
2. Ctrl+F to activate Find
3. Enable regex search
4. Enter `\n`
5. See that it matches all the line endings
6. Now try searching for the last two characters from a line _including_ the line ending: \n
7. See that the nothing is found and Find believes there are "No results"

![15_06_36-adminwk-002 - remote desktop connection manager v2 7](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1189638/22129120/07ec6022-de59-11e6-9d31-6cd27c58340a.png)

![15_07_59- untitled-4 - visual studio code](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1189638/22129142/1a941ce2-de59-11e6-8e7d-9ac22fceecfe.png)

data.title: Improve markdown preview to editor mapping
data.body:
Two changes:

* Adds a hover indicator for elements with directly corresponding lines in the markdown preview.
* Improves the mapping from pixel positions in the markdown preview to line numbers. We now use the same logic as the editor to preview mapping to round to lines that don't exactly match an element

data.title: Extend revealLine command to Support Reveal Line of Unfocused Editor
data.body: To implement scrolling synchronization from the markdown preview to the markdown editor, we currently use the `revealLine` command. This command only applies to the currently active document. In order to properly implement scroll sync, we would want to extend this command to take an optional `resource` argument with an editor Uri, plus a flag indicating if the editor should be focused or not after the reveal.

data.title: Searching for a setting returns hits on non-contiguous letters
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|lorem-ipsum|Tyriar|1.0.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Workspace Settings
2. Search for the word 'color' (without quotes)

Expected result is any hits of the term with the letters in succession and contiguous.  

Actual result is any setting where the letters c-o-l-o-r occur anywhere in the setting or its comment, so long as they are in order.  For example, here is one result:
// **Co**ntrols the **l**ocation of the sidebar. It can either show on the left **or** right of the workbench.

Highlighted colors from the result are shown in bold above.

data.title: VSCode not attaching to ES6 files from sourcemaps when debugging mocha
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

I have an odd structure in my app which looks like this:

${workspaceRoot}/Controls/src         --  My Source files (ES6)
${workspaceRoot}/Controls/test        -- My Tests (ES6) 
${workspaceRoot}/.tmp/tests              -- Temporary Output directory for webpack bundle for testing with mocha

launch.json Entry:

```
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "Launch Mocha",
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/mocha/bin/_mocha",
            "stopOnEntry": false,
            "args": [
                "${workspaceRoot}/Controls/test/setup.js", 
                "${workspaceRoot}/.tmp/tests/bundle.js"
            ],
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "sourceMaps": true,
            "outDir": "${workspaceRoot}/.tmp/tests",
        },

```

Webpack config for building test package:

```
module.exports = {
    devtool: 'source-map',
    entry: './tests.webpack.js',
    externals: {
        'cheerio': 'window',
        'react/addons': true,
        'react/lib/ExecutionEnvironment': true,
        'react/lib/ReactContext': true
    },    
    output: { path: path.join(__dirname, '.tmp/tests/'), filename: 'bundle.js' },
```

I have confirmed that after building the webpack, these files exist:
${workspaceRoot}/.tmp/tests/bundle.js
${workspaceRoot}/.tmp/tests/bundle.js.map

The tests execute properly, but no breakpoints are hit when I place them in test files. If I search through the JS bundle and place a breakpoint in there, it will hit the break point in ES6 code saying "read-only inlined content form source map" in the tab.

Any thoughts I what I have wrong here?

Thanks!

data.title: [Proposal] Fractional Line Number Locations
data.body:
I'm investigating syncing the scrolling of the markdown preview window to the editor. I have an implementation working using the `revealLine` command, but it is fairly jittery. In order to smooth out scrolling and continue using `revealLine` or similar existing apis, I believe that one approach would be supporting revealing line numbers that are not whole numbers.

![screen shot 2017-01-19 at 12 49 00 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/22124732/e286b75a-de45-11e6-9059-3ba4751202ce.png)

I see two possible ways we could implement this:

* Use fractional line numbers to indicate the view line to reveal. In the example, a reveal of line `12.5` in the above document would reveal the third viewport line of line 12 in the editor. This still not allow entirely smooth scrolling since it would be locked to viewport lines, but it would be better than our current approach.

* Use fractional line numbers to indicate the progress between two lines. In this case, a reveal of line `12.5` would reveal the position halfway between line 12 and line 13 in the editor. This would not map to a specific line, so scrolling could be smoother.


Of course we could also investigate creating a new api to support this use case. Just tossing out some initial thoughts here to see what people think.

@kieferrm @egamma  @bpasero @jrieken: Any thoughts?

data.title: vscode.ExtensionContext.storagePath is undefined the 1st time an extension is activated for a workspace
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Debug the C++ extension C_Cpp.ts activate method.
2. context : vscode.ExecutionContext has a value of undefined for the storagePath the 1st time the extension is activated for a new workspace. It repros in all cases, such as when no other files are open, and the extension is activated after the workspace is opened.

The bug starts reproing again after the folder C:\Users\\<user\>\AppData\Roaming\Code\User\workspaceStorage\\<guid\> is deleted.

Seems like a bug in VS Code?

data.title: Ability to configure long commit warning length

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
It would be nice to configure how long a commit message is before it displays the warning. Some repos I work on allow a 75 char line length, while others allow 100. I know we can enable/disable via `git.enableLongCommitWarning` config. Would be nice to add one more config for length.

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Enter a commit message longer than 50 characters.
2. Observe warning.

data.title: Panel: weird behaviour with "Debug Console"
data.body:
I see two weird bugs:

1. hide the panel by moving it down to the status bar
2. reload window
3. from the status bar drag up to show the panel and notice how the debug console is missing the editor input to the bottom:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/22119938/c1fc75f0-de7d-11e6-824e-519eb11bffc7.png)

1. click on problems in the panel
2. hide the panel by moving it down to the status bar
3. reload window
4. from the status bar reveal the panel by dragging up from the status bar
=> the previous panel is not restored, instead I see the debug console again

data.title: Cannot install extensions behind a Secure Web Gateway that enforces certificate checking

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Trying to install extensions to VsCode on RHEL in a VM that's behind a corporate SWG fails, even when the OS has a trusted root certificate.

VSCode
-
Version 1.8.1
Commit ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281
Date 2016-12-19T14:41:20.664Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0

OS
-
Linux localhost.localdomain 3.10.0-514.2.2.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Wed Nov 16 13:15:13 EST 2016 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux


Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install RHEL in a virtualbox VM
2. Create a trusted root certificate that should get you through the inline proxy appliance, 
>$ sudo yum -y install ca-certificates
>$ sudo update-ca-trust enable
>$ sudo sh -c "cat > /etc/pki/ca-trust/source/anchors/internet-browsing-ca.crt" << "END"
>-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----
>...sha256...
>-----END CERTIFICATE-----
>END
>$ sudo update-ca-trust extract
3. launch vsCode and try to install an extension

What results:
getaddrinfo ENOTFOUND redhat.gallery.vsassets.io redhat.gallery.vsassets.io:443

data.title: Some feedback for SCM
data.body:
I understand it's beneficial for VSCode to abstract away SCM to allow multiple source control systems.

However, my initial reaction was that it's taken away some of the functionality I had with the Git module, which was awesome.

Is there a flag or something we can change to bring back Git? I miss are being able to undo my commit.

|docthis|joelday|0.3.9|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.9.3|
|vscode-clearcase|OpenNingia|1.4.2|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.0.1|
|theme-cyanicpastels|SamuelLampa|0.0.9|
|indenticator|SirTori|0.2.1|
|vscode-hexdump|slevesque|1.1.4|
|code-spell-checker|streetsidesoftware|0.14.6|
|comment-snippets|Tobiah|0.2.0|
|dark-plus-material|vangware|0.1.4|
|change-case|wmaurer|1.0.0|
|highlight-trailing-white-spaces|ybaumes|0.0.2|

---

Request ability to search only in the files that are loaded in the editor. In addition it would be good to have a search results window for find (in current file Ctrl+F) so that you can see a list of matches with some context and the ability to copy the search results and click on them to go to the match. This should also work with replace. May be there should be another window like Output, Problems, etc. Ideally this would be able store multiple sets of search results in multiple windows. See SlickEdit for example.

data.title: eslint problems that don't exist showing up in problem log, but not UI
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.0-insider@215a0a
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create code with inherited .eslint.js
2. Open it

Disclaimer: seems possible this is related to eslint plugin, but the issue is only occuring in the insider build, not in the last release build, both with the same version of the plugin (1.2.2) and the same config.

I have the following config:

    ./.eslintrc.js
    ./test/
    ./test/.eslintrc.js

The `test/.eslintrc.js` inherits the root:

```javascript
'use strict';
let root = require('../.eslintrc.js')

module.exports = Object.assign({}, root, {
    "env": {
        "mocha": true,
        "node": true
    }
}
```

eslint config is working as expected from CLI, and the UI doesn't show any squiggly errors for issues that aren't expected. But does show them for actual issues, as expected -- I added `reallyNotDefined` to demonstrate that. 

But the problem log is filled with errors that indicate the inner `.eslintrc.js` is not being parsed when testing files below it. (nb, this seems pretty odd to me, why would the UI be using a different set of output than the problem log for jslint errors? does eslint get run twice all the time, once for the UI and once for the problem log?)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/573056/22114077/45c10fb0-de36-11e6-916e-8daec8684e85.png)

data.title: Cannot copy all content from debug console, only visible selected output is copied.
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:
Version 1.8.1
Commit ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281
Date 2016-12-19T14:41:20.664Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0

- OS Version:
Linux 3.13.0-24-generic #47-Ubuntu SMP Fri May 2 23:30:00 UTC 2014 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Start debug session with more than a screen of output
2. (Try to ) select all output and copy to clipboard
3. Open text editor and paste clipboard

Result:

Only visible output in debug console is copied to clipboard. Even when it seems that all text is selected. You can scroll and see text is selected but when text is copied, only visible part will be in the clipboard.
